intro: Mitrophyllum kubusanum, commonly known as the Kubusanum mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of specific host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its leafless stems and fleshy, spherical fruits. The plant relies on its host for water and nutrients, while it provides nectar to attract pollinators. It is native to the Philippines and is often found in lowland to montane forest ecosystems. Due to its restricted distribution and ecological specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
